title: duchess cornwall thanks hospice staff
story: Duchess of Cornwall thanks hospice staff for going above and beyond’ through pandemicThe Duchess said she was ‘immensely proud’ of all the staff at the Royal Trinity Hospice in Clapham, south London. Her visit was aimed at raising millions of pounds for the hospiceThe Duchess of Cornwall visits the Royal Trinity Hospice in London Image: PAByRussell MyersRoyal editor:,  Dec The Duchess of Cornwall has thanked dedicated staff at a hospice for going “constantly above and beyond” throughout the pandemic during a visit to launch the centre’s Christmas appeal, Camilla praised the efforts of staff and patients at the Royal Trinity Hospice in Clapham, south London, adding that she was “immensely proud” of them.Her visit was aimed at raising millions of pounds for the hospice, which has been impacted by the closure of charity shops and the cancellation of fundraising events due to the coronavirus pandemic.The Duchess, who has been a patron of the hospice since , met with a group of nurses before joining them to switch on their Christmas lights. She told hospice staff: “You are all marvellous. We owe you such gratitude for constantly going above and beyond. “It is a very special place here and you are all wonderful.”  During her visit, the Duchess also met with Rahul Moodgal who told her how nurses had cared for his father Onkar in his final weeks as he succumbed to Parkinsonaposs and Alzheimeraposs disease in . Mr Moodgal, a father of two, said his dad at first “was dead against” going to the hospice as he “thought it was like a prison”.  He said: “He was such a character and was dead against coming here. But after a few days, he quickly realised how utterly amazing the staff were and he loved it in the end. “I would come in to see him and he would say he was having a great time chatting up the nurses. They were all so great with him and it made the world of dference to us as a family.”  The Duchess replied: “Well it’s wonderful to know he was so well looked after.” She also paid a private visit to the inpatient unit of the centre where she was able to speak with nurses, doctors and some visiting families privately.  She then attended a carol singing by children from St Mary’s RC Primary School, Clapham before turning on the Christmas tree lights and saying: “I wish you all a merry Christmas.” The event traditionally marks the start of the Christmas appeal by Royal Trinity Hospice, which was founded as the National Free Home for the Dying in  following an appeal for funds in The Times. The hospice became known as Royal Trinity Hospice in  in recognition of the long patronage of the Royal Family and was previously under the patronage of The Queen Mother.As a result of the coronavirus pandemic, the centre must make up more than £m every year to supplement NHS funding. Dr Samantha Lund, the centreaposs medical director, said: “The Duchess’s recognition of all the staff’s hard work is really quite special considering the daily heroic efforts that we have seen to keep going throughout the pandemic. “They are tired but no less enthusiastic and everyone here has pulled together to deliver truly exceptional care for our patients and their families. “We have had to adapt constantly which has provided its challenges, from phone calls and video calls with loved ones, to the changing guidelines and wearing PPE throughout but I couldnapost be prouder of every single colleague. “Our association with the Duchess of Cornwall is such a special bond and it makes all the dference to everyone for her to support us as she has throughout her patronage since .” Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Camilla, Duchess of CornwallPlan BNHSThe TimesEducationRoyal FamilyMental healthAlzheimers diseaseChristmas lightsChristmas treesCoronavirus" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: kate middleton delivers hopeful christmas
story: Kate Middleton delivers hopeful Christmas message as she hosts carol service with WilliamThe Duke and Duchess of Cambridge arrived at Westminster Abbey to attend the Together at Christmas carol service, which will be broadcast on Christmas EveCatherine, Duchess of Cambridge attends the Together at Christmas community carol service Image: Getty ImagesByRussell MyersRoyal editor:,  Dec Updated:,  Dec The Duchess of Cambridge got straight into the Christmas spirit by dazzling in festive red for a special carol concert alongside Prince William. Kate gathered , unsung Covid- heroes to record a festive telly spectacular at Westminster Abbey. She was welcomed by familiar faces including Mila Sneddon who stole the duchessaposs heart after she bravely coped with leukaemia during the pandemic. Mila, six, gave the duchess a twirl her green sequinned dress before taking her seat behind the royals. Mila said afterwards: She asked me what I was getting from Father Christmas and I told her I wanted a Barbie Dreamhouse.  I showed her my dress and she said I looked lovely. Mum Lynda said: Last two Christmases Mila has been in hospital so we are looking forward to having Mila at home this year. We are just an ordinary family it is amazon ti be invited. The youngster, from Falkirk, in Scotland, sat behind Kate and the rest of the royals also gave a short reading during the hour-long ceremony.  Popstars Leona Lewis and Ellie Goulding and England footy hero Jordan Henderson and comic Jason Manford sprinkled festive stardust. Zara and Mike Tindall, Sophie Wessex and Princess Beatrice and hubby Edo Mapelli Mozzi, also took their front row seats.  The festive bonanza was filmed by BBC Studios but will be screened by ITV on Christmas Eve instead because of a royal row over last monthaposs documentary on Wills and Harry last month. Everyone wore masks in line with new rules to battle the spread of the new Omicron iant of Covid-. Kate, who wore a Catherine Walker coat and sapphire diamond fringed earrings on loan from the Queen, wrote a foreword in the Abbeyaposs order of service. She said: The Covid- pandemic has presented us all with countless and previously unimaginable challenges. We have lost loved ones, seen our frontline workers placed under immeasurable pressure, and we have experienced heart-wrenching isolation from those we hold most dear. “Alongside this, we have seen how communities have come together to support those most in need. And through our separation from others, we have been reminded just how powerful human connection is to us all. Just how much we need one another. And how loving and feeling a sense of belonging to one another can provide comfort in tough times. The importance of simply being together.  “In our roles, William and I are so fortunate to meet and spend time with phenomenal people across the country who day-in day-out support iniduals and families. And over the past two years, we have been truly inspired by countless people who have brought their communities together through simple acts of long and kindness. This carol service is our small way of recognising the inspiring contribution so many of you have made. Thank you. Christmas is a time when we can reflect on the past, listen to one another, focus on the relationships that nurture us and build our resilience, so we can look forward to a shared brighter future. My hope is that this service creates a moment for us to do this together. Over the next hour we will celebrate the power of this time of year. And I wish you all the very best for the year ahead.” Kate and Wills also chatted with Ellie Goulding and Leona Lewis who performed at the bash. Kate said to Ellie, dressed all in white: It is nice to get doing things like this as not been able for so long. Leona, in a green dress, said: This is very special. It my first time here.  The Duke and Duchess also send up to  minutes mingling with many of the everyday heroes invited to the bash. Colonel David Blum, , who met Kate last month as part of the Remembrance Day celebrations, beamed after she sought him out in the seats. He said: My family are far away so I wonapost be seeing them at Christmas so I am very grateful to be invited. It is a lovely trip to London. Kate is very charming. Kate, , hosted the hour-long concert with carols and music last night but the full details are being kept secret ahead of the hour-long Christmas Eve screening. But it can be revealed that X-Factor winner Leona Lewis and Ellie Goulding - who played at Kate and Williamaposs wedding more than ten years ago - performed on stage. Viewers will also see a performance of a poem created for the occasion called To The Day by poet and writer Lemn Sissay. Wills, , gave his own star turn by delivering a reading to the audience and was joined by Telly host Kate Garraway and paralympian and doctor Kim Daybell. Heroes of Operation Pitting which helped evacuate , people from Afghanistan were also in the audience.  Other heroes were chosen by the Duke and Duchess and nominated from across the country and from patronages and charities of The Queen and Prince Wales, also received an invite to the festive fun. They included representatives from  charities close to the coupleaposs hearts such as Barnardoaposs, Centrepoint and NHS Charities Together. Comic Jason Manford was rewarded for taking up a job as a delivery driver for Iceland and driving over-s for medical appointments. England hero Jordan Henderson took his seat in the Abbey as he was praised for starting the aposPlayers Togetherapos initiative where Prem stars donated wages to help the NHS.  Singer George Ezra, who gave his songs to Joe Wicks to use during his Covid PE lessons, and rado DJ Adele Roberts who supported Kate and Willaposs aposOur Frontlineapos campaign to provide help for  heroes were also in the audience. Mila Sneddon and her family were guests of honour after meeting Kate as part of her aposHold Stillapos photo project. Zigi Shipper and Manfred Goldberg, both , also took pride of place, after meeting Kate this year for Holocaust Memorial Day in the Lake District. Last nightaposs aposTogether at Christmasapos concert was held in aid of charity and supported by the coupleaposs Royal Foundation.  It was arranged to pay tribute to the work of heroes and groups who have worked tirelessly in their communities during Covid-. Royal sources say the concert was aimed to get families together over Christmas to reflect on the extraordinary challenges and acts of kindness seen across the country. All faiths were included in the event which also featured Christmas carols sung by the Westminster Abbey choir. The event will be broadcast as part of Royal Carols: Together At Christmas, a special programme which will be aired by ITV at :pm on Christmas Eve. The broadcast will feature additional content including an introduction from The Duchess of Cambridge, videos highlighting the efforts of inspirational organisations. Plus a special performance by Tom Walker of his new Christmas single For Those Who Can’t Be Here. news uk-news kates-mum-says-christmas-tradition-"CHARLOTTE, GEORGE AND LOUIS CLAP FOR THE NHSByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Dec | commentsThe Duchess of Cambridgeaposs mum has revealed a Christmas tradition she loves carrying out with her grandchildren is back on the cards again this year. Carole Middleton has previously told of how she normally allows her grandchildren - who include Prince George, Princess Charlotte and Prince Louis - to decorate one of her Christmas trees.However, Covid restrictions last year meant Carole, who runs the party supplies business Party Pieces, was unable to see the youngsters and instead they carried out the tradition via Zoom.However, taking to the Party Pieces Instagram page, the grandmother-of-five confirmed the tree decorating ceremony would be taking place again this year. She wrote: Once again this year we plan to have two Christmas trees: one for the children to decorate and one which I do myself. And it seems that helping out the royal children will be Kateaposs sister Pippaaposs kids Arthur and Grace.Meanwhile, Carole also previously revealed another decoration she will be hiding around her home for her grandchildren - Christmas gonks.Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up. In recent years, the Scandinavian gnomes have boomed in popularity across Britain and Carole, whose Party Pieces business sells the dolls, also wrote on her firmaposs Instagram page: I’m going to need a few of these cheeky chaps this December, to hide around the house and make my grandchildren laugh. “As much as I love immaculate decorations, we can’t be too serious at Christmas!”Itaposs believed that Kate and Prince William along with George, Charlotte and Louis will be spending Christmas this year at Sandringham with the rest of the Royal Family before spending time at the Middletons.But despite effectively celebrating Christmas three times, one royal expert has said William and Kate will be sure to try not to spoil George, Charlotte and Louis too much.Royal expert Duncan Larcombe has said the couple will want their children to feel normal and won’t be lavishing them with expensive gts.Mr Larcombe told OK! that the family will be celebrating Christmas on their own, together with the more formal event at Sandringham with Williamaposs family and spending time with Kate’s family.He said: I think we’re looking at three Christmases rolled into one for William and Kate and their children. “There will be Christmas on their own with their kids, the more formal celebrations at Sandringham with William’s family and then time with Kate’s family, the Middletons. But something we know for sure about William and Kate is that they want their children to feel normal and so they certainly won’t be lavishing them with expensive gts, that’s for certain. They won’t let them be spoiled.” Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Prince GeorgePrincess CharlotteRoyal FamilyKate Middleton, Duchess of Cambridge" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: mum humiliated after shes told
story: Mum humiliated after being told to leave social club bar as women not allowedJulie Simpson visited Cargo Fleet Social Club, in Middlesbrough, to cheer on her darts playing partner, bur claims members allegedly shouted at them: Get your lass out of hereJulie Simpson said she felt humiliated after she was told to leave the mens only area of a Teesside social club Image: Teesside LiveByIan Johnson:,  Dec Updated:,  Dec A mum who claims she was ordered to leave a social club’s bar due to her gender is slamming the venue for having rules she “thought had vanished decades ago”. Julie Simpson visited Cargo Fleet Social Club, in Middlesbrough, to cheer on her darts playing partner, only for members to allegedly shout get your lass out of here at her. The alleged yelling happened after Julie stepped foot in the bar - where women were not permitted - rather than the lounge area. But a club secretary has fired back, insisting rules are rules - and claimed they donapost let women enter the bar over fears they would be exposed to bad language or fighting. Julie, who has worked in hospitality since she was a teenager, said she felt humiliated by the incident, and is now questioning why, in , rules like this still exist. The drama unfolded on Sunday night, after teetotal Julie drove herself and her partner to the Middlesbrough club for the darts league match.  She said: We both went to the bar to order our drinks, and the next thing we knew we were being shouted at - they were shouting aposget your lass out of here! Get your lass out of here! Sheaposs not allowed in here so get her out!apos It was really degrading - I just thought to myself what the heck  And it was just normal customers bellowing at me. But there was a woman barmaid in there, and as I was talking to her she just told me that they are aposold fashioned in hereapos.” Julie said she was left feeling about “two foot tall”. She continued: “I turned to my other half and said aposlook, play your darts and Iaposll come back and pick you up - but he said no. I go everywhere with him, and Iaposve never experienced anything so horrible. It was disgusting. Julie claimed there were no posters on the clubaposs wall explaining the rules, nor did the barmaid flag it up.  Yet for the clubaposs secretary Brian Wilson, her gripes fall flat. He insists the venue is all about inclusiveness, citing the -plus women who drink there as guests - although as non-members they arenapost allowed a vote. They get a card, and they are allowed to go to the Christmas party - it is all free for them - and it seems the only person who is complaining is a woman from a dferent club, he said. And I think sheaposs bulls******g, as we have a lady who plays five and threes every Wednesday, and she comes and sits in the same room as . He believes her claims are an attempt to give the club a bad name - and insists the rules are there more to shield women from the antics of boozed-up blokes. He added: It is an old fashioned working menaposs club and we donapost think it is rightwhen there are men effing and blinding in the bar - it isnapost right when there are ladies sitting there. When askedwomen are incapable of handling hearing swear words, he added: Well some would. Butyou had a couple in on a night out, and a fight breaks out at the bar, it isnapost very nicetables are going over. We donapost have no lady members in the club, they are all guests and we have a dart room and we allow them to sit in the dart room. But because of the bad language situation and the drunken situation, we donapost like women in the bar. Legally, the  Equality Act allows clubs or organisations to restrict membership to people who share a protected characteristic - which includes gender. Brian said the club aims to make women feel welcome. We have plenty of room for them, we have a great big lounge for them with music and bingo on. Butthey do come with an away darts team, we do allow them to sit inbut we do not allow them to go to the bar, unless they go to the bar in the lounge. He suspects the club is one of around three of four local venues that still prohibit women from entering the bar area. The clubaposs rules mean women can visit as guests - but canapost be full fee-paying members. He added that they enjoy all the perks of the club, apart from access to certain parts as well as the vote given to the men who pay subs. He added: Our other lady members donapost have a problem with it, so I donapost see why someone from another place should. We do a lot for the community. We have a Christmas party for the pensioners - all women - they are not members but we pay for it They get £ each, a good feed and a turn on. Weaposve never had one complaint from a woman in this club. So for someone to come from another club and complain - I just canapost believe it. Yet Julie couldnapost believe she had fallen victim to rules she thought had vanished decades ago. And she has also questioned that,the venue is so concerned about women hearing bad language, why they would employ female barmaids. What happened would be degrading to any woman. The more I think about it, the more I feel discriminated against and degraded,” she said. To be shouted out, and told no women in here - I just donapost understand. news uk-news omicron-must-tackled-urgently-avoid-"Omicron iant will dominate Delta before Christmas says expertByAlice Peacock:,  Dec Updated:,  Dec Government advisors have warned hospital admissions from the Omicron iant could reach , a day by the end of the yearextra restrictions aren’t put in place. Leaked minutes of a meeting of the government’s scientic advisers held on Tuesday revealed the shocking numbers. While the predictions around the Omicron iant were dramatic, the overall scale of hospitalisations is still uncertain.But the figures, which had been seen by the BBC, made clear that an urgent response was needed to reduce spread and pressure on the NHS. It comes as Boris Johnson announced this evening that government guidelines would include advice to work from home due to the scale of the iant.Such changes raise concerns about Christmas festivities, as families hope to gather for celebrations after a dficult festive period in .The Prime Minister is already facing a growing backlash for a Christmas Party reported to have been held in Downing Street last year while much of the country was under tough restrictions. The government is currently trying to slow the spread of the Omicron iant to allow for more people to get their booster jabs. The UK has reported  new cases of the iant today, the UK Health Security Agency confirmed. The total total number of confirmed cases of the mutant strain now stands at . There is growing early evidence that booster vaccine doses could be an effective defence against the Omicron iant, despite the strain being the most mutated iant of the virus detected so far.BioNTech and Pfizersaid today a three-shot course of their vaccines produced a neutralising effect on the new Omicron strain in a laboratory test.The announcement was the first statement from the manufacturers on the likelihood of their shots being effective against the iant. They added that a vaccine targeting the rapidly spreading strain could be delivered by March next year.  The Scientic Advisory Group for Emergenciescomprises around  scientists, who offer advice to the government on how to react to the pandemic in the UK.Minutes of their latest meeting this week said it was “highly likely” the new Omicron strain would account for the majority of new coronavirus infections in the UK within “a few weeks”.“With the speed of growth seen, decision makers will need to consider response measures urgently to reduce transmissionthe aim is to reduce the likelihood of unsustainable pressure on the NHS,” they continued. Scientists also cautioned the peak of the wave was “highly likely to be higher” than , - , Omicron hospital admissions per day without new rules to slow the spread of rising infections. According to the latest seven-day average, there were currently around  people being admitted to hospital each day with the Delta iant in England. In comparison, hospitals were admitting , Covid patients a day at the peak of the last winter wave. Another point that was not yet clear was whether Omicron would replace infections from the older Delta iant or whether both strains would spread simultaneously. Scientists also said the rate and other specics around the spread would depend on the degree to which they infected dferent groups or demographics of people. The minutes from the meeting went on to say: “Evidence suggests that measures could be reintroduced with expectation of a similar level of adherence as has been seen in the past. “Adherence is likely to be highermessaging and policy have clear rationales and are consistent. Other points covered by the advisors were that the number of omicron infections in the UK was now increasing rapidly, with evidence of community transmission. Hospital admissions from Omicron were expected to follow soon. Taking measures which would slow or delay the Omicron-driven wave of infections would allow more time for vaccination. This could aid the situation in ensuring increasing coverage and booster shots of existing vaccines. The current speed of growth meant decision makers needed to consider response measures urgently. If the aim was to reduce the likelihood of unsustainable pressure on the NHS, transmission needed to be reduced. SAGE scientists also stated that the reduction in severity of disease from Omicron would not avert high numbers of hospitalisations,growth rates remained as high as they were currently. news uk-news plan-b-brings-new-covid-"Boris Johnson announces move to Plan B for Covid restrictionsByLorraine KingNews Reporter:,  Dec Updated:,  Dec | comments Boris Johnson has announced new rules which involves tighter mask restrictions to curb the spread of the Omicron coronavirus iant.Speaking at a Downing Street press conference on Wednesday the Prime Minister said he was implementing aposPlan Bapos which will also see the introduction of Covid vaccine passports and a renewed aposwork from homeapos policy. He said the new rules are coming into force as the doubling time of the new strain could be between two and three days - meaning its spread will be rapid. Face masks have already been mandatory by law in England’s shops, supermarkets, gt shops, indoor shopping centres, public transport including taxis and indoor stations, banks and post offices since November . They are also compulsory at hair salons, barbers, nail salons, massage centres, tattoo and piercing studios.  You must also wear a face mask during driving tests and lessons - plus at pharmacies, vets, auction houses, retail galleries, takeaways , estate and lettings agents, high street solicitors and accountants. Under-s are exempt and anyone who canapost wear face coverings for medical reasons. But from Friday they will become mandatory in more venues. They must be worn in theatres, places of worship, cinemas, public libraries or community premises.  Those who do not comply can be fined £ for a first offence , doubling on each repeat offence up to £,. Police will be expected to enforce the rules. But there are exemptions when you are eating, drinking, singing or exercising so face masks are not mandatory in pubs, restaurants or gyms. Secondary schools in England were recommended to ask pupils to wear masks in communal areas and corridors at the end of November. There are reports of talks ongoing about whether to extend this. However there was no immediate announcement.  Under the government’s ‘Plan B’ rules, any contact of a suspected Omicron case will be forced to isolate for  days. Mr Johnson said: “We will reintroduce the guidance to work from home. “Employers should use the rest of the week to discuss working arrangements with their employees but from Monday you should work from homeyou can. “Go to workyou must but work from homeyou can.” However Mr Johnson also said Christmas parties could go ahead but that people should exercise caution. He said: Itaposs OK to keep going with Christmas parties but obviously everybody should exercise due caution, have ventilation, wash your hands, get a test before you go - give everybody  confidence they are going to be meeting somebody who is not contagious.” It came as the PM apologised unreservedly over allegations of a Christmas party held at Downing Street last year when lockdown rules banned social gatherings – but he continued to deny all responsibility. news uk-news queen-gives-glimpse-adorable-never-"Queen wanted to set example at Christmas says expertByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Dec | commentsThe Queen seems to like to fill her private rooms in her castles and palaces with sweet photos of her family. And today, she appeared to offer a glimpse of an adorable previously unseen picture of herself posing with the late Prince Philip alongside some of their great-grandchildren.It came as the Monarch was presenting the Queenaposs Medal for Music to concert organist Thomas Trotter during an audience at Windsor Castle this morning. The cute framed snap could be seen on a side table resting alongside her trusty black handbag.Andyou look closely it appears to show the Queen and Philip sitting on a sofa with the Queen holding a young Princess Charlotte on her knee.It seems as though Prince George is standing behind them with Isla Phillips - daughter of Peter Phillips - to the side of Her Majesty. Mia Tindall - the daughter of Zara and Mike Tindall - appears to sit in between her great-grandparents with Savannah Phillips - Peteraposs other daughter - seemingly standing proudly beside Philip.Itaposs thought the picture must have been taken before  as some of the younger great-grandchildren donapost feature. Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up.Meanwhile, another lovely snap also framed on the table shows the Queen and Philip with their great-grandchildren at Balmoral in . It was taken by the Duchess of Cambridge and released by the Royal Family following the death of the Duke of Edinburgh in April. This picture does feature Prince Louis as well as Lena Tindall.Since those photos were taken, the Queen has welcomed another five great-grandchildren.  They are Prince Harry and Meghan Markleaposs children Archie and Lilibet, Princess Eugenieaposs son August, Zara Tindallaposs third child Lucas and Princess Beatriceaposs daughter Sienna.The Queen is believed to be set to spend the next week or so at Windsor Castle before travelling to Sandringham for her traditional family Christmas. She is said to be looking forward to the get-together, where many of her grandchildren and great-grandchildren will be present. title: queens palace staff utter dismay
story: Exclusive: Queens Palace staff in utter dismay at Downing Street Christmas party scandalThe Queen was evacuated from Buckingham Palace at the start of the pandemic and formed a support bubble with her late husband Prince Philip who moved from his home at Wood FarmQueen Elizabeth II watched as pallbearers carry the coffin of Prince Philip Image: Getty ImagesByRussell MyersRoyal editor:,  Dec | commentsPalace staff serving the Queen have reacted with “utter dismay” at the Christmas parties scandal enveloping Number . Dedicated servants, many who were forced to spend substantial amounts of time away from their loved ones over the pandemic after entering protective bubbles at Windsor Castle and Balmoral to protect the monarch, said there was “palpable anger” at the revelations over illegal lockdown parties in government.The Queen was evacuated from Buckingham Palace at the start of the pandemic and formed a support bubble with her beloved late husband Prince Philip who moved from his home at Wood Farm on the Sandringham estate in Norfolk.Other royal staff said “sacrices made from the very top all the way down” to keep people safe were being rendered “worthless”. One servant with more than  years service within the household said some colleagues had become “visibly upset” when discussing how the Queen was forced to sit alone at her beloved late husband’s funeral in April due to coronavirus restrictions.Her Majesty, like thousands of others across the nation as the pandemic raged on, complied with covid restrictions leaving them to alter plans for funerals or tragically being unable to say goodbye to their loved ones as they lay dying in hospital. Staff who cared for the Queen and Duke of Edinburgh throughout the pandemic told how they had made “huge sacrices” to maintain strict covid bubbles in the belief they were “doing out bit” to keep the monarch safe from the deadly virus. One said: “It would be a gross understatement to say people are angry. “Many missed Christmas, birthdays, other special occasions and weeks on end away from their families. “But it was all in the spirit it was for the greater good and we were doing our bit. “It’s a slap in the face for anyone frankly.”  The Queen was last year forced to spend a final Christmas alone with Prince Philip at Windsor Castle, before he passed away aged  in April. The image of the -year-old dressed in black with a black mask covering nearly her entire face while sitting alone in St George’s Chapel at Windsor Castle will be forever etched in the nation’s memory. Labour leader Sir Keir on Wednesday highlighted the head of state’s leadership and the sacrices she made at the Duke of Edinburgh’s funeral during the Covid- crisis at Prime Minister’s Questions.He was speaking as Boris Johnson faced the furore over claims Downing Street staff broke lockdown rules by holding a Christmas party last year.Sir Keir told the Commons: “Her Majesty the Queen sat alone when she marked the passing of the man she’d been married to for  years. “Leadership, sacrice - that’s what gives leaders the moral authority to lead. “Does the Prime Minister think he has the moral authority to lead and to ask the British people to stick to the rules ” The Queen was due to have her weekly audience with the Prime Minister on Wednesday, either by person or by phone. Buckingham Palace did not comment. Her Majesty has been resting on doctors’ orders and only carrying out light duties such as audiences since spending a night in hospital for preliminary tests on October , and later spraining her back. She is also preparing to film her Christmas Day message to the nation. The Queen is likely to use her annual pre-recorded televised speech, which she writes herself, to reflect on the ongoing challenges facing the country, as well as touching on her own personal grief with the loss of Philip in April. The royal family is hoping to gather to celebrate Christmas with the monarch at her Sandringham estate in Norfolk after last year’s festivities were curtailed due to the pandemic. But some royal fans still like to look over the beautul pictures and footage that captured the memorable day.And it seems some have spotted a secret message hidden on the coupleaposs wedding car, which they used to drive to their evening reception.On that day, Harry and Meghan set off from Windsor Castle to Frogmore House in a blue Concept Zero E-type Jaguar, with Harry at the wheel.The sports car was originally manufactured in  but has since been converted to electric power.  In a blink and youaposll miss it moment, the car registration plate on the vehicle read E. news uk-news single-mum-living-rodent-infested-"Mum living in constant fear in mouse-infested houseByAnna HighfieldAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Dec | commentsA single mum who claims to be living in a rodent-infested house says she lives in fear of her four-year-old autistic son eating mouse poo. Tamekia Thompson, , says she is desperate to move from her south London home. The mum-of-two claims rodents eat her food, and the floors and cupboards are strewn with thousands of droppings.Tamekia, a private tenant who moved into the property in  with her two young children, said the house became infested with mice two years ago, MyLondon reports. She said her seven-year-old daughter is incredibly stressed and she is terried her four-year-old autistic son who will eat anything will ingest the droppings and get sick. Tamekiaaposs landlord claims he has put in measures to address the infestation.  Christian Mantey told MyLondon he has a contract with a pest control company, who have laid traps in the house and have agreed to visit every two weeks to dispose of dead mice and fill in holes. He added that the process is taking longer than usual because pest control cannot put poison down over safety concerns with Tamekiaaposs son. He also explained that the tenant is aware of this. Mr Mantey said he has now issued a Section  eviction notice to Tamekia, who has not paid her rent for around seven months. He said: Iaposve given [Tamekia] her Section  notice telling her to leave because sheaposs in arrears of £,. In terms of the rodent issue in the house, thereaposs been pest control that has come to the property, I think about a month ago while she was there. They set up all the traps and all the other equipment they needed in front of her. She said they canapost put certain traps around because of the kids, so they adjusted the traps according to how she wanted it. They come every two weeks, Iaposve got a contract with them that they will come every two or three weeks to pick up the dead mice or whatever they find, and to fill up the holes. He added: Iaposm doing what Iaposve got to do, the pest control is doing what theyaposve got to do, you canapost eradicate these things straight away. Tamekia claims she is withholding the rent due to problems with the house, including the rodent infestation.She said that she left her job in August to care for her son full time and is now dependent on Universal Credit from Croydon Council to pay her rent, which she says she hasnapost paid due to the mouse infestation.Tamekia says she was told by a pest control worker that, because of the severity of the infection, it would be tricky to get rid of them. Tamekia also said the house also has severe issues with damp on one of the walls. However, Mr Mantey claims Tamekia has never told him that her failure to pay rent is due to her problems with the house, or the mouse infestation. Mr Mantey also claims he has had someone fix the damp in the house two years ago and Tamekia didnapost complain again until two weeks ago. He said he has recently been contacted by Croydon Council about the house, who he said have given him  days to get aposspecicapos jobs done in the house, including fixing the damp and repairing the windows. He said: There are people coming to do the whole property. Iaposm sorting it. Speaking about the mouse infestation, he added: Getting rid of any infestation takes whatever itaposs going to take. Tamekia, who is currently on a housing waiting list with Croydon Council, moved into the house to support her sister, who had access to the property under the Shared Lives scheme through the council. The former care worker said: My kids are scared, screaming, crying, they donapost want to sleep in the room. My daughter said to me aposmummy Iaposm stressedapos... and it really broke my heart. I can tell sheaposs frustrated. She said: [My son] will eat anything, you have to be watching him. Tamekia said her family gets sick a lot: My kids they are vomiting and stuff like that... every minute we are catching colds... itaposs just hard work for me to be cleaning [mouse] poo every day... The council confirmed Tamekia is on a housing waiting list but have advised her to seek alternative accommodation due to a housing shortage. Steve Reed, MP for Croydon North, also raised the issue with the council in September, but contacted Tamekia on November  to say he was yet to receive a response. A Croydon Council spokesperson told MyLondon that they have advised Tamekia on her current private arrangement with her landlord. They say they have advised her to seek alternative accommodation through the private rented or social housing sector, as there is a housing shortage. A council spokesperson said: “Although this is not a council property, we have provided Ms Thompson with advice and support around her housing options in both the private rented sector and social housing. We have also been in contact with her landlord about repairs to his property.” Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Steve ReedSingle mumAutismHousing" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news uk-covid-infections-three-times-"Omicron expected to peak in January says expertByMilo BoydNews Reporter:,  Dec | commentsCoronavirus cases are much higher now than they were this time last year, as the threat of the Plan B response looms.Over the past week Covid infections have shot up % across the UK, with a further , cases recorded yesterday alone. That is three times the number of cases, ,, logged on this day last year. Hospitalisations and deaths are signicantly lower now than they were at the beginning of December  however. On Tuesday  people died and , were in hospital with Covid, compared to  deaths and , patients in hospital a year ago. Have you been affected by Omicron  Email webnews@mirror  While the Covid vaccine is primarily responsible for this much-improved situation in terms of fatalities and the strain on the NHS, the Omicron iant has made the future much more uncertain than it was just a few weeks ago. Scientists have warned that the mutant strain could be three times more infectious than other iants. They predict that , people in the UK are catching the new iant each day while new cases are doubling every three days. Although much research into Omicron is yet to be done, there have been some suggestions that it can evade the vaccines to at least a small degree. At the moment deaths and hospitalisations - while high compared to other European countries - are steady.However,they start to rise over the coming weeks, the Government may decide to bring back restrictions designed to stop the coronavirus spread.Boris Johnson is reportedly considering Plan B for the festive period which could be put in place in the coming days, possibly even as soon as tomorrow. He may decide to do sothe spread of Omicron is threatening to overwhelm the NHS. At the moment scientists believe that Omicron cases in the UK are doubling every three days. Professor Neil Ferguson told the Today programme this morning that the new iant would be the dominant one, overtaking Delta, by Christmas. The Imperial College London epidemiologist predicted that Omicron cases would peak in Januaryno additional measures were taken by the Government.Prof Ferguson said a new year lockdown is apospossibleapos, although it depends on how much pressure the NHS faces in the coming weeks.When pressed about the chance of a lockdown in the new year, he said: At the moment itaposs very dficult to rule out anything we really havenapost got a good enough handle on the threat. If the consensus is itaposs highly likely that the NHS is going to be overwhelmed then it will be for the Government to decide what it wants to do about that but itaposs a dficult situation to be in of course. Itcertainly might be possible at the current time.  He said a laboratory-based South African study published last night indicated that Omicron can evade antibodies developed against the original strain better than any iant so far. Professor Ferguson anticipated that case numbers, which are currently doubling every two to three days, will accelerate aposquite markedlyapos within a week or two. The Government may decide to reintroduce social distancing measures to stop the rise in cases getting out of control. Its Plan B would mean people being told to work from home to limit the spread of the virus while vaccine passports could be enforced for entering events with crowds including football matches, it is reported.  If the rules are introduced, many Brits may be left with a feeling of de-ja-vu. A week before Christmas  a planned relaxation of rules for the festive period were scrapped due to the emergence of the Delta iant. Prime Minister Boris Johnson held a press conference on December  announcing that Christmas as planned was effectively cancelled. From midnight that day a new tier four was introduced, banning people from mixing indoors with anyone not from their household. news uk-news uk-weather-exact-date-cold-"Storm Barra: Met office predicts bad weather will continueByAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Dec Updated:,  Dec | commentsThe weather forecast is finally looking brighter after nearly two weeks of snow, torrential rain and wind. The mercury is set to hit double digits by the end of the week after plummeting to below zero in some places.From Thursday, December , conditions will improve and it will come as much-needed relief following Storm Arwenapos s lashing over the UK last month and the continued battering from Storm Barra today. Grahame Madge, a spokesman for the Met Office, told the Mirror: There are no weather warnings and that is indication weather conditions are going to become more stable. We will still have weather such as frost and rain, but the impact on people will be a lot less. The potential to cause disruption is reduced. He also said that that from tomorrow, temperatures will start to climb again. Mr Madge said: In the period over the next few days temperatures are coming back up and the risk of snow is really confined to areas above -metres such as in the Scottish Mountains. Meaning impactful snow at low levels is not likely to be a feature of the forecast.  There is a system that will bring rain overnight and into Thursday and Friday, and it will then largely be clear. Conditions may become more choppy, but there are no further warnings scheduled. From that point of view itaposs more stable. He added: For the most part in Southern and Central England temperatures in the daytime are in the double figures with Bristol reaching  and Nottingham reaching  degrees. The only places that will stay in single digits will be parts of Scotland, Newcastle, Leeds and Northern Ireland. Crucially, overnight temperatures in Southampton and London are predicted to remain in double figures.The Met Office long-range forecast predicts bright spells in the East and showers from the will West come in.Hill snow is still likely up North, but temperatures will hover at about the average for the time of year - which is about C.  There is a risk of another largely unsettled period with further showers and longer spells of rain, heavy in places, with a chance of gales for some exposed areas, but not until after conditions improve first. It comes after Storm Arwen left thousand without power after mph winds and lashing rain at the end of November, and as Storm Barra continues to batter the UK for a second day. Today, Brits are being warned to prepare for strong winds, rain and ice leading to flooding as the country is battered for a second day by Storm Barra.  Gales and snow blizzards caused chaos on Tuesday with wind gusts reaching mph at Aberdaron, in Gwynedd, while around , homes in north-east Scotland, Northern Ireland and Wales lost power. Now dozens of flood warnings have been issued across the UK along with the Met Office also issuing a yellow weather warning of gales in England for Wednesday. New rules for traders and hauliers who move goods into Great Britain from the EU come into force on Jan  . There is still time to take action and keep your business moving. There is plenty of support on offer and the Government is ready to help you navigate your way through these new changes. Visit GOV.UK Brexit to prepare for the new rules today. The Environment Agency has issued  flood warnings for England at locations including Hartlepool and Sunderland in the North East, Bournemouth and Weymouth in the South, and part of the Cumbrian coast.  Some  flood alerts, for areas where flooding is possible, have also been issued across the country. The continued chaos comes as communities in the North East and Scotland are still trying to recover from the catastrophic effects of Storm Arwen. Thousands of homes lost power for up to  days in the wake of mph winds and lashing rain at the end of November.  Northern Powergrid has not confirmed whether all homes were connected by Tuesday night as promised. Met Office forecasters said Storm Barra may not cause as much chaos as Storm Arwen – though it has already sparked travel delays and school closures in Scotland. Spokeswoman Nicky Maxey said: “We are not expecting the impacts of Barra to be as bad as we saw with Arwen. “Storm Barra will bring strong winds and heavy rainfall to many parts of the UK today. We may see some snow on the higher ground, too. “It is unlikely to be as impactful as Storm Arwen last week but there will be blustery conditions so people should still be prepared.” Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Met OfficeEnvironment AgencyNew YearSnowWeatherFloodsBREXIT EU NEWSJACKING" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news uk-weather-storm-barra-brings-"Storm Barra batters Im A Celeb Castle as crew race to secure itByJeremy ArmstrongNews Reporter:,  Dec Updated:,  Dec | comments The last homes and businesses without power finally had supply restored today - as Storm Barra brought more chaos.Northern Powergrid confirmed electricity was finally back on in all , properties affected by the damage,  days after Arwen, the “worst storm in over  years”. But the mph winds of Storm Barra brought more danger and destruction. In Scotland, more than , properties were without power - just days after the final homes were reconnected after Arwen hit on Nov . Northern Powergrid apologised to its customers, and thanked them for their patience, particularly in the hardest hit areas of Northumberland and Co Durham.  They pledged to look at ways to improve their performance “in the event of major power cuts”. “We have made some changes,” said a spokesman. “We will learn more lessons from the reviews that will follow.” Mary and Terry Laycock, who live in a small hamlet at the foot of the Cheviot Hills near Wooler, Northumberland, were among the last people to get power back on. “I don’t think they knew we existed. We just seemed to be forgotten about,” she said. “Mountain rescue came to see us and the police also came round with leaflets to say where we could get a free hot meal.  “I have been cooking on two gas canisters and we have also been for fish and chips. I think I have lost everything in the freezer but at least my daughter took the Christmas turkey back to hers.” John Charlton, a Northern Powergrid engineer, was doing -hour days. “Everyone has really dug in deep to get everyone back on supply,” he said.Met yellow weather warnings remained in place in England and in Wales, with the risk of power outages, and flying debris.Bryngwyn Comprehensive School in Llanelli, Wales, shut temporarily after  mph gusts ripped off part of its roof. No one was injured. Wind speeds of  mph were recorded in Aberdaron, Gwynedd, a week after a  mph gust was recorded in Aberporth, Ceredigion, during Storm Arwen. Coastal communities were warned to take care close to piers and harbours, with huge waves hitting seaside towns in Dorset, Devon and Cornwall. The waves were so large in the village of Borth in Ceredigion, Wales, that locals were asked to avoid the area completely. Hyder Ali Pirwany, of Okehampton, Devon, filmed a hailstorm that left the streets carpeted in white. He said:”There was thunder and lightning at first, followed by heavy sleet and hail which piled up like snow. “It knocked out my television and FM radio reception - it is back now almost  hours later.” The Scottish Environment Protection Agency issued  flood alerts and three flood warnings, with more rain forecast today. title: cruel trolls slam pregnant mum
story: Cruel trolls slam pregnant mum after she shows how she cooks for her  kidsVeronica Merritt, from New York, took to TikTok to share what she made her children for dinner using food she had leftover from the month - but people were ided Image: @thismadmama   TikTokByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Dec Updated:,  Dec | commentsA mum has received some harsh criticism over the dinner she made her  children.Veronica Merritt, from New York, shared what she made her kids for dinner on her TikTok, @thismadmama.In the video, she firstly cooked the pasta in boiling water, while adding  sticks of garlic bread to the oven. After cooking the vegetables and adding a tomato sauce to the pasta, she then plates up the meal for her family. She said: For tonight’s dinner I decided to go with just a simple, meatless pasta with some sauce and some frozen veggies and some garlic bread. While many parents praised her efforts, a few others were concerned by how much butter she used on the vegetables and the lack of protein.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Since being posted, the video has racked up more than , likes and almost , comments. One person said: No seasoning at all. Another wrote: Why eat veggies at all  Just eat butter. A third commented: There is no protein. Itaposs all carbs, to which Veronica replied saying: Look at breakfast  lunch yesterday. We already had protein. No need to have it x. Someone  put: Iaposd still be starving... that was one scoop of pasta. Veronica responded saying her children are allowed morethey want it, but babies tend to waste. Four of my kids are six or younger, she claried.  Veronica was forced to address the criticism in the comments, where she said: Before telling me I canapost cook, please see my other videos. This was an aposend of the month cleaning out old stuffapos kind of dinner.apos Others rushed to defend the mum, as one person said: Yaposall really disregarded the fact sheaposs cooking for  people. She doesnapost have time to cook a -star meal every day. While another added: Literally where are all of these negative comments coming from    Some kids have parents who DONaposT care to FEED THEM. These children are blessed. Veronica was just  and in ninth grade when she found out she was three months pregnant with her first child Victoria, who is now  years old. Her son Andrew, now , came five years later during her first marriage. After her first marriage broke down, she married Marty, , with who she had seven more children. Marty and Veronica had Adam, , Mara, , Dash, , Darla, , Marvelous, eight, Martalya, six, Amelia, four, Delilah, three, and Donovan, one, as well as the child she is currently expecting.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: he wont pay wont clear
story: He wont pay so I wont clear the snow - I dont care that hes elderlyA man has taken to the internet for advice after being chastised by his we - because he refused to help his elderly neighbour clear his drive of snow unless he is paidA man said he refused to clear his elderly neighbours drive for free Image: Getty Images Aurora OpenByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Dec Updated:,  Dec | comments A man left his family ided after he refused to help his elderly neighbour clear the snow from his drive unless he was paid, as his we said he should have done it for free.Sharing his story anonymously, the man said that he had never got on with his neighbour and he resented his constant complaints, about his dog, noise, or whatever  was annoying the elderly man that day. Then when it snowed the neighbour, who is in his s, turned to the man for help and asked him to clear his drive - but the man said he wouldnapost do it unless he was paid. The neighbour refused so the man didnapost help, but now his we is saying he was in the wrong and should have done the work as the man was old and needed help. What would you have done in that scenario  Let us know in the comments...Taking to Reddit, the man said: This summer, he told us that my relationship with him was no longer friendly, and we were to be strictly neighbours for the rest of the time that we lived together. Last night we got our first big snow of the season. Instead of snow blowing his driveway like I usually do, I snow blowed mine and went back inside.  minutes later, he texted me saying that he was going to breakfast with his friend and needed his driveway snow blowed so he could get out.  I responded that I would no longer be doing his driveway for free since he had said that our relationship was no longer friendly. I offered to do his driveway for £ , or I said he could pay one of the kids that live in the neighbourhood. He got pissed and told me that he didn’t have time to coordinate with the neighbourhood kids and that he needed his driveway snow blowed. I told him I would do it for £. He said he refused to pay me to do his driveway. So I told him I wouldn’t do it. It’s later in the day now and he hasn’t cleared his driveway yet. I feel great, but he called me an a*****e in his texts and my we told me I might be an a*****e because he’s old. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. After seeking advice online, other Reddit users rushed to the manaposs defence and said he did nothing wrong. One said: People need to realise being old isnapost an excuse to behave like an a*****e. Would you feel badhe was in his s  Nope. He made his bed now he can lie in it. And a second wrote: My son shovels out the elderly neighbouraposs driveway, which is crazy long and steep to boot. She gives him fty bucks and tells him heaposs the most handsome boy in the world. Iaposm just saying this is the minimum standard. Tell your neighbour youaposll do it for  or fty bucks and being told youaposre the most handsome boy in the world. While a third added: If he wants neighbourly kindness, he has to be a kind neighbour. He made it very clear he wasnapost interested in that kind of friendly relationship, so you donapost owe him more than he asked for, which was strictly neighbours. If the old b*****d needs your help, he needs to be your neighbour and not an a*****e. Otherwise, he needs to find someone  to help him or pay for it.Do you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it. title: hidden door disneyland theme parks
story: Hidden door at Disneyland theme parks that will cost you £, to walk throughThe Disneyland theme parks have been visited by millions of families who have tried out every rollercoaster ride and food stand there is to offer - but theres one place that only a special few get to visitThe elusive Club  door will cost you to walk through Image: Los Angeles Times via Getty ImagesByJessica TaylorReal Le Features Writer:,  Dec Itaposs every childaposs dream and many parentsapos worst nightmare - a proper trip to Disneyland, complete with characters and rollercoasters. While kids all around the world are desperate to visit the Disney theme parks in Paris, Florida, Calornia or Tokyo, many mums and dads dread what it will bring. Although itaposs a magical place and brings joy to their kids, the parents spend much of their day queuing for rides, holding the bags, and forking out for expensive snacks. Meanwhile, the youngsters excitedly run around trying to spot their favourite Disney characters so they can grab a photo - while the parents diligently follow them around. For more of the news you care about straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here But, as with many things in le, the rich and famous donapost quite have the same experience when visiting this magical land with their kids. In fact, there are several dferences when celebrities take their little ones to Disneyland - meaning they donapost have to endure quite as much hassle as us Average Joes. Perhaps the biggest dference is how they get in and out of the park in the first place, with a series of special doors to ensure the A-listers of the world can go about their park fun without detection. News.au reports big celebrities bringing their children to Disneyland are accompanied by a park guide who takes them exactly where they need to go - without spending precious time trying to work out the park map. The non-VIPs among us can still opt for a guidewe want to, but itaposll cost - estimated to be more than £ per hour. Another luxury afforded to the rich and famous is access to the secretive Club  - Disneyaposs elite members only club. It costs £, to sign up to the club, followed by an annual membership of more than £,. The door to the original Club  lounge is designed to look unassuming and like any other door in the park, but inside is a plush bar with fancy furniture in the dining area. Once the VIP guests have finished up in the lounge, they can enjoy fast passes to the bigger rides in the park that attract the biggest queues - although even being famous canapost get you out of queuing altogether, and fast passes tend to be a - minute wait. But thereaposs one place that remains off limits to even the special guests - Walt Disneyaposs apartment above the fire station. Almost  years after he died, the Disney founderaposs flat is off limits to almost all visitors as he is still technically in charge. title: i dont trust mother law
story: I dont trust my mother-in-law with my baby - Im afraid what she might doA mum has admitted she doesnt want to leave her -month-old daughter alone with her mother-in-law after shes repeatedly tried to pierce her earsThe mum doesnt want her mother-in-law left alone with her baby Image: Getty ImagesByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Dec | comments Many parents rely on family members, including their own parents, to help out with child care to enable them to go back to work and just provide general support. But one mum has vowed not to rely her own mother-in-law for childcare support, even going as promising to never leave her daughter alone with her.The -year-old mum had always gotten along with her husband Japoss mum, however they recently butted heads after she asked when they would be getting their -month-old daughter Caposs ears pierced. The mum told her mother-in-law that C would not be getting her ears pierced until sheaposs old enough to ask to have them done herself, and in response, was told that sheaposs a hypocrite considering she has several piercings herself. My own mother wouldn’t let me even get my earlobes pierced until I was , but my mother-in-law had both had both my sister-in-lawsapos ears pierced when they were tiny, and she keeps going on about how aposit’s better because they won’t remember itapos, the mum wrote on Redditaposs AITA forum.J says he supports whatever decision I make on the matter because I’m the one who would have to clean it, as I stay home with C while he works full time. The mum thought the issue had been put to bed, until a few weeks ago, when her mother-in-law was taking care of C for them as they were going to a funeral. As I was coming down the stairs I hear my mother-in-law talking to C about how aposthey’re going to go out shopping and get her some pretty earrings.apos I went into the room and told her in no uncertain terms that that would not be happening, andI can’t trust her to respect my decisions about my own daughter I would find someone  to look after her, she continued, adding that she ended up getting her sister to babysit. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Now my mother-in-law keeps trying to arrange to have her for a few hours, she even tried to offer to have her overnight so J and I can go out, but I refused. I told her she could come and visit her, but I no longer trusted her not to get her ears pierced behind my back, so she would be seeing her unsupervised. The mum said that both her husband and her sister-in-law think sheaposs overreacting, prompting her to turn to Reddit to question whether others thought her reaction was justied. She definitely intends to get her ears pierced. Iaposm of the opinion that itaposs unfair to put a baby through unnecessary pain, as they canapost understand it. Vaccines serve a purpose and are justied, but earrings donapost. Your daughter will grow up just fine without them and can ask for them when sheaposs ready, one Reddit user commented. The bigger concern is your mother-in-law not respecting your authority as the mother. Please donapost allow her unsupervised visits with your daughter as she doesnapost seem trustworthy. Another agreed: Of course her children think youaposre overreacting they were raised by this human bulldozer and donapost know any better. Their opinions on boundaries canapost be trusted. Also, the idea that your husband defers to you because you would be solely responsible for the care and cleaning just because you stay home  Like... is he incapable of holding a Q-tip between the hours of  and pm  She is his daughter, too, and he absolutely has a vested interest in whether his mother goes behind both of your backs to do this.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: mum spends year extreme elf
story: Mum spends all year on extreme Elf on the Shelf pranks - including real tattooMum-of-five Julie Ann Thorn is Elf on the Shelf obsessed. She first started participating in the tradition eight years ago, but her festive scenes have only gotten bigger and better" content"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES n _PAY-ELF-ON-THE-SHELF-OBSESSED-MUM-SPENDS--MONTHS-PREPARING.jpg" width"" "" Julie Ann loves seeing her sons faces light up when they see the elves Image: Julie Ann Thorn   CATERS NEWSByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Dec | commentsElf on the Shelf is the unlikely Christmas tradition that has taken over in recent years. For those who are unfamiliar with the concept, Elf on the Shelf was created to encourage good behaviour in the run-up to Christmas. The premise behind it is that you tell your children that the elf will report back to Santa Claus each night to say who has been naughty or nice, ing in the morning to a new spot in the house. But coming up with  dferent locations for your elf can be quite a tough task. This is why one mum spends all year getting ready for the naughty elfaposs antics. Mum-of-five Julie Ann Thorn has been doing elf on the shelf for the past eight years and spends months preparing and collecting props for her extravagant scenes.For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. From filling entire rooms with balloons and polystyrene to building a huge snow globe in her lounge and even asking her sonaposs dad to get a tattoo of the elf as part of one of the pranks, Julie Ann has really thought of it all. Julie now mainly creates the magic for her youngest son, youngest son, Finley, seven, with the help of her older sons, Liam, , Evan, , Owen, , and Lucas,  and her husband, Graeme, . Julie said: I have always loved Christmas and making a fuss. When I was young my parents were very over the top with it and I wanted to do the same for my family. Iaposd seen a friend doing Elf on the Shelf in the US about eight years ago, so I wanted to try it and make it more exciting for the kids.  And over the years I have just gone more and more extravagant. I spend all year planning my ideas and making notes in a book. Some of the ideas take months of preparation. For example, I once created a winter wonderland using polystyrene from packaging from our new kitchen. It took so long to get it all into black bags and store in the shed until we were ready to use it at Christmas. I even chanced my luck one year and asked Finleyaposs dadhe would get a tattoo of the elf for one of the pranks and on his day off he actually went and got it. I couldnapost believe it.  Finley was in utter shock and was trying to rub the tattoo off of his dad. It was hilarious. Julie says that she feels a lot of pressure to perform with the elf on the shelf as friends tell her they canapost wait to see what she has created. Her youngest, Finley, is completely absorbed in the magic of it, so Julie is determined to keep it alive and spends  months planning and looking for amazing ideas. She added: Finley races downstairs every morning to see what the elf has been up to. He knows that on the first night of December the elf sneaks into his room and changes his bedding while he is asleep and there are glittery footprints left through the house. All of his brothers get involved too which makes it extra special. I look for props all year round and I make lists in the back of my notebook to plan ahead for December. I like to keep a note of any good ideas on social media too. I am usually quite organised and have everything sorted in advance, but sometimes I come across things and improvise, for example, I recently managed to get my hands on a cardboard Coca Cola truck that I am going to use. I think I am going to fill it with shopping and then Finley can donate it to a local food bank. Making a snow globe in the living room is one of the most extravagant ideas I have done so far this year.  I bought a paddling pool in the summer to use as the base. And filling rooms with balloons takes quite a lot of days to prepare because of blowing up the balloons. It looks really impressive too. Itaposs sometimes dficult to find places to hide all of our props, but luckily we have a cellar where we can keep things and Finley wouldnapost go down there because heaposs scared of spiders. I love creating such magic for him every day in the build-up to Christmas. I love seeing his face each morning.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: my wild christmas office party
story: My wild Christmas office party had it all - beach sex, trashed hotel and heart attackThe big boss treated  of us to a Christmas party abroad... the only condition was that we wouldnt upset the locals, writes Patrick ReidDuring the evening things went downhill - and fast... Image: GettyopinionByPatrick Reid:,  Dec Updated:,  Dec | commentsWhen I was a rookie futures trader, the owner of my company hired a luxury hotel in Barcelona for our Christmas bash. We had an incredible year trading, and so as a treat he paid for  of us to go on holiday for a knees up.But before we left he issued us with one stern condition: we would not upset the locals and get too drunk. Famous last words.It started quite civilised as we managed to see a football game at Camp Nou and I got to see the beautul city and architecture. I even popped into the Picasso museum for a couple of hours. That is about as good as it got for being well behaved and sticking by the rules set by the boss. During the evening things went downhill - and fast. The club led onto a beach, and after the third tequila a few of the female traders decided to steal my clothes and wear them. Running around trying to look for them was useless, so I just had to borrow a coat from a mate.  The DJ weaposd hired threw a real tantrum and left because he was fed up with our “music requests. What he didnapost know is we all had a bet to see how many times he could play Princeaposs Kiss . Around am the ambulance got called to help an older trader who we thought was having a heart attack. Thankfully it was just really bad heartburn but we were all really worried for him at the time. What got me was he actually came back to the bar for another drink afterwards! What a legend fool - delete as you see fit. The last thing I remember is wearing a trilby hat trying to look cool and failing while chatting up the receptionist - then seeing two couples having sex on the beach, in full view of everyone.  When the bill came we insisted on paying for the clean-up which apparently was nearly as much as the drinks weaposd guzzled. The fallout didnapost come until two months later, but it was a great bonding exercise and I’ll never forget it. I never thought you could have a hangover that lasted a whole week. Turns out you can, but I do not recommend it. Now my le is far more relaxed and I’ll remember those days with affection.... and embarrassment.*Patrick Reid is the co-founder of Adamis Principle and an FX traderRead MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Heart attackChristmas party" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news weird-news parents-sickened-after-catching-creep-"Dad cant comfort son as creepy man talks through baby monitorByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Dec | commentsA apossickenedapos mum fears her family have been spied on in their own home for weeks after her toddler kept waking in the night - only for them to discover a aposcreepapos talking to him through the baby camera. Shannon Richardson, from Banbury, Oxfordshire, says her -month-old son Freddie had been inexplicably waking up every night around am and refusing to go back to sleep, leaving her and partner Jack Gray perplexed. However, the couple were horried to discover the aposexplanationapos - when they heard a aposdeep male voiceapos talking to little Freddie through the camera, which was so clear they thought someone was in the house at first. Racing into their sonaposs room, Jack ripped the aposhackedapos monitor out of the wall from where it had been positioned to film their youngster - before throwing it into a skip. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Shannon, , was left so scared that it could be a aposlocal manapos that she insisted on staying at her mumaposs house even after it had been thrown away and once home had Freddie stay in bed with her. Now the care assistant fears that the man could have been watching their son for weeks and even seeing the couple trying to calm him, with images on the monitor showing Jack climbing into the cot to try to sooth his son. Shannon said: The sickness, upset and disgust we feel is awful. How long has this creep been watching Freddieaposs room  We get him changed after bath times and put him to bed in there. We donapost know how long this has been going on for because, for a while, heaposd been waking up at the same time in the night at around am and we werenapost able to settle him. Jack was getting in the cot to try and comfort him. Weaposd been trying to settle him and nothing would work so we think someone was waking him up. But now weaposve removed the baby monitor, he hasnapost been waking up in the night. Images caught on the monitor show Jack, who works in fire and flood restoration, comforting his son in the cot in the middle of the night in the weeks leading up to the incident in October, to no avail. Shannon said: It was around .am and me and Jack were watching TV. We had the camera on and we heart rustling so we watched it for a minute thinking it was probably Freddie moving around in his cot. All of a sudden, we heard this really deep, male voice and it was so clear, we thought he was in the bedroom. He was saying aposbabyapos and aposbabaapos like he was trying to wake Freddie up. Jack ran upstairs and barged into Freddieaposs room. No one was in there but the monitor moved towards Jackaposs direction. The voice had come through the monitor. Jack just ripped the monitor out of the wall and picked Freddie up. We went into our bedroom and just sat there not knowing what to do. We were in shock. I didnapost know what to believe or to think. Shannon says the manaposs voice had been so clear that they thought someone was in the house and that the incident has left her feeling scared in her own home. Shannon said: Jack threw the monitor in a skip. I didnapost want to be in my house, I kept going to my mumaposs even though the monitor was gone. I didnapost feel comfortable and I was on edge. I was scared because we didnapost knowit was a local man. I wasnapost comfortable putting Freddie to bed on his own so he was sleeping in my bed with me but I had to eventually put him in his own bed so he didnapost get too used to being with me. Shannon had been given the video baby monitor as a gt while she was pregnant and had been using it ever since Freddie was born, Shannon said: I thought it was really handy because when he was in bed, it was nice to be able to see him. Weaposve been using it since he was born. Baby monitors are supposed to be a safe thing to watch your baby. You would never think that someone  would be watching them through it.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. moment a little girl repeatedly drops the f-bomb in a frustrated rant after watching her dad lose a game of Fortnite. Mya Diment-Card, two, had been given a controller by her dad -year-old Liam Card, so that she would think she was playing along with him too. But she ended up getting so involved with the game, that when her dad was beaten, she instantly reacted with frustration, and said the naughty word again and again. Mum Melissa Diment, , captured the sweary language on camera, as well as Liamaposs shocked reaction as he admitted the behaviour was so out of the blue. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Liam, from Salisbury, Wiltshire, explained: We were just playing Fortnite and I had her with one controller so she felt like she was playing even though she wasnapost. She was sitting there one minute loving it, but when we died thataposs when she started swearing. It was so out of the blue and my poor missus, who was recording it thinking it was cute her playing with her daddy, was shocked! I think she probably learned that off me for sure, Iaposm in trouble with the missus, he added.Melissa posted the video on her TikTok @milliam_c, with the caption: wait for it, and has since been viewed more than , times.It also received almost , likes and hundreds of comments from people in hysterics at Myaaposs reaction.
